definitions: performed with smooth, connected notes without breaks between them in music
examples: The pianist played the melody in a legato style
This passage requires a legato touch to sound beautiful

definitions: famous or well-known through stories passed down over time
so remarkable or impressive as to inspire stories or great admiration
examples: King Arthur is a legendary figure from British folklore
The legendary heroes of ancient Greece inspired many tales
Her legendary patience helped her teach difficult students
The team's legendary comeback will be remembered for years

definitions: having a particular number or type of legs mentioned
examples: The three-legged stool wobbled on the uneven floor
Long-legged birds wade through shallow water searching for fish

definitions: clear and neat enough to be read or deciphered easily
examples: Please write in legible handwriting so others can understand
The ancient manuscript was barely legible after centuries

definitions: great in number; existing in large quantities or amounts
examples: Her fans are legion across the entire country
The problems facing the company are legion and complex

definitions: lacking legs or having lost the use of legs
so drunk as to be unable to stand or walk properly
examples: The legless lizard looks like a snake but isn't
Some legless amphibians live entirely underground
He was completely legless after the bachelor party
They found him legless outside the pub at midnight

definitions: done without hurry in a relaxed and enjoyable manner
examples: They took a leisurely stroll through the park
We enjoyed a leisurely breakfast on Sunday morning

definitions: extended or stretched to become longer in distance, duration, or extent
examples: The lengthened shadows indicated evening was approaching
Her lengthened absence began to worry her friends

definitions: extending along or in the direction of the greatest length
examples: Cut the cucumber lengthwise into thin strips
The fabric has a lengthwise pattern of stripes

definitions: lasting or extending for a considerable time or distance
examples: The committee held a lengthy discussion about policy
She wrote a lengthy email explaining her position

definitions: showing mercy or tolerance; not strict in punishing or judging
examples: The judge was lenient with first-time offenders
Parents became more lenient as their children matured

definitions: relating to or appropriate for the Christian period of Lent
examples: The church serves simple lenten meals during this season
Many observe lenten fasting traditions before Easter

definitions: relating to or characteristic of women who are sexually attracted to other women
examples: The lesbian couple celebrated their tenth anniversary together
She writes about lesbian themes in contemporary literature

definitions: reduced in size, amount, degree, or intensity from before
examples: The lessened rainfall caused concern among farmers
His lessened enthusiasm was noticeable to everyone

definitions: smaller in size, amount, or importance than something else
examples: She chose the lesser of two evils
The lesser planets orbit closer to the sun

definitions: capable of causing death; extremely dangerous or destructive
examples: The snake's bite contains a lethal dose of venom
Mixing those chemicals creates a lethal combination

definitions: affected by lethargy; sluggish, drowsy, and showing little energy or enthusiasm
examples: The hot weather made everyone feel lethargic
After the large meal, he became lethargic and sleepy

definitions: marked or inscribed with letters of the alphabet
well-educated, especially in literature and the humanities
examples: The lettered blocks helped children learn the alphabet
Each lettered section corresponds to a different topic
The lettered scholars debated philosophy late into the night
Only the most lettered citizens could read ancient texts

definitions: relating to the Philippines, its people, culture, or languages
examples: Filipino cuisine combines Spanish and Asian influences
She studied Filipino history at the university

definitions: relating to Finland, its people, language, or culture
examples: Finnish saunas are an important cultural tradition
He's learning Finnish to communicate with relatives

definitions: relating to Flanders, its people, or the Dutch language spoken there
examples: Flemish painters were renowned during the Renaissance
The museum displays beautiful Flemish tapestries

definitions: relating to Florence, Italy, its people, or their culture and art
examples: Florentine architecture showcases Renaissance beauty
The chef prepared eggs in traditional Florentine style

definitions: relating to St. Francis of Assisi or the religious order he founded
examples: The Franciscan monks live in simple poverty
Franciscan values emphasize peace and care for nature

definitions: relating to Sigmund Freud or his theories of psychoanalysis
examples: Her Freudian slip revealed her true feelings
The therapist used Freudian methods to analyze dreams

definitions: relating to Gabon, its people, or their culture in Central Africa
examples: Gabonese music features traditional drums and modern styles
The Gabonese rainforest contains incredible biodiversity

definitions: relating to the Celtic languages of Scotland, Ireland, and Isle of Man
examples: Gaelic football is popular throughout Ireland
She's studying Gaelic to connect with her heritage

definitions: relating to Gambia, its people, or culture in West Africa
examples: Gambian cuisine features rice and peanut dishes
The Gambian river provides water for many communities

definitions: relating to Mahatma Gandhi or his philosophy of non-violent resistance
examples: The protesters used Gandhian methods of peaceful resistance
Gandhian principles influenced civil rights movements worldwide

definitions: crude and offensive in a sexual way; lustful or lecherous
examples: His lewd comments made everyone uncomfortable at work
The comedian's lewd jokes crossed the line of decency

definitions: legally responsible or obligated for something, especially debts or damages
likely or prone to do or experience something undesirable
examples: The company is liable for any injuries on their property
Homeowners are liable for accidents on their premises
She's liable to forget if you don't remind her
That old bridge is liable to collapse in storms

definitions: freed from traditional social conventions or physical restraints
examples: The liberated women pursued careers previously denied to them
He felt liberated after leaving his restrictive job

definitions: having official permission or authority to do something specific
examples: Only licensed electricians can perform this type of work
The restaurant is licensed to serve alcohol until midnight

definitions: dead or apparently dead; not containing or supporting life
lacking energy, vitality, or excitement; dull and uninspiring
examples: The lifeless body was discovered early this morning
Mars appears to be a lifeless planet
Her lifeless performance disappointed the theater critics
The party was lifeless until the band started playing

definitions: closely resembling or representing real life in appearance or manner
examples: The wax figures looked incredibly lifelike
Her lifelike paintings fooled viewers into thinking they were photographs

definitions: lasting or remaining throughout one's whole life
examples: They remained lifelong friends after meeting in college
Her lifelong dream was to visit every continent

definitions: raised or moved to a higher position or level
taken without permission; stolen, especially in a casual way
examples: The lifted spirits of the team showed in their performance
His lifted eyebrow expressed skepticism
The lifted wallet contained important identification cards
Someone lifted my phone while I wasn't looking

definitions: provided with light or lighting; illuminated or set on fire
examples: The lighted pathway guided visitors through the garden
A lighted candle flickered on each dining table

definitions: cheerful, carefree, and free from worry or serious concerns
examples: The lighthearted comedy made everyone laugh and relax
She maintained a lighthearted attitude despite the challenges

definitions: weighing relatively little compared to others of its type
lacking importance, influence, or intellectual substance
examples: This lightweight jacket is perfect for spring weather
Aluminum is a lightweight metal used in aircraft
Critics dismissed him as a lightweight in political debates
The book offers only lightweight analysis of complex issues

definitions: pleasant, friendly, and easy to like; having agreeable qualities
examples: Her likable personality made her popular with coworkers
The movie's likable characters kept audiences engaged

definitions: pleasant, friendly, and easy to like; having agreeable qualities
examples: His likeable manner put nervous patients at ease
The candidate's likeable demeanor won over many voters

definitions: regarded with favor, approval, or affection by someone
examples: The well-liked teacher received gifts from grateful students
His liked posts on social media went viral

definitions: having a pale pinkish-purple color like lilac flowers
examples: She wore a beautiful lilac dress to the wedding
The sunset painted lilac streaks across the sky

definitions: having a pleasant rising and falling rhythm in speech or music
examples: Her lilting voice made the lullaby especially soothing
The lilting melody reminded him of Irish folk songs

definitions: having limbs of a specified kind or number mentioned
examples: The strong-limbed athlete excelled at climbing
Many-limbed creatures inhabit the ocean depths

definitions: capable of bending easily; flexible and agile in movement
examples: Dancers must keep their bodies limber through stretching
The limber gymnast performed amazing contortions

definitions: imposing restrictions or serving to restrict scope, extent, or freedom
examples: The limiting factor in production was raw material supply
These limiting beliefs prevent people from reaching goals

definitions: without end, limit, or boundary; infinite in extent or possibility
examples: Children have limitless imagination when creating stories
The universe seems limitless in its vast expanse

definitions: lacking stiffness or firmness; soft and drooping
lacking strength, vigor, or effectiveness; weak
examples: The flowers looked limp after days without water
His limp handshake failed to inspire confidence
The team's limp response disappointed their supporters
Her limp excuse didn't convince anyone

definitions: in a direct line of descent or ancestry; hereditary
examples: He is the lineal descendant of the town's founder
The throne passes to the lineal heir
